entry.title: BigCommerce seamless integration with SAP Cloud ERP - Complete Setup & Demo Guide
entry.content:
Tired of Juggling Data Between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce? We‚Äôve Got You Covered!

Managing data and business processes across SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition) and BigCommerce can often be a challenging and time-consuming task ‚Äî especially when done manually or through custom-built integrations. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to introduce a ready-to-use integration package powered by SAP Integration Suite, built to simplify and streamline your operations.

Designed specifically for B2C commerce scenarios, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures:

  • Seamless data synchronization between SAP and BigCommerce
  • Automated workflows for key business processes
  • A reduction in manual tasks and potential errors

In this blog, we‚Äôll start with a high-level overview of what the integration offers. Then, we‚Äôll walk you through a step-by-step guide to setting up the package ‚Äî so you can get your systems connected and running efficiently with minimal effort.

Note : SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package accelerator isn‚Äôt just limited to B2C. Partners can extend the integration to support B2B use cases as well, tailoring it to fit the needs of more complex business models. The package is built with extensibility in mind, so partners can enhance it further to accommodate specific business requirements or tailor it to specific industry needs. Partner can enhace the Integration Flows for bidirectional synchronization between BigCommerce & SAP Cloud ERP for the following entities:

  • Products, Price, Discounts & Tax
  • Product Variants ( Recommend customer project to leverage separate Products )
  • B2B Customer Master Data & Payment Settlement Flows
  • Enhance the use-case to cover Promotions and Classification

 

Overview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Integration Package:

SAP provides a variety of pre-built integration accelerators via the SAP Integration Suite, all accessible through the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Among these, we‚Äôve developed a dedicated BigCommerce integration accelerator that enables a seamless connection between your BigCommerce storefront and SAP Cloud ERP and its available with SAP Cloud Integration Suite Starter Edition and Standard Edition.

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures real-time data consistency across both platforms by synchronizing key business objects such as:

  •  üõí  Product information
  •  üì¶  Inventory levels/Product Stock
  • üí≤Product Prices & Discounts 
  •  üë§  Customer information

By automating critical business processes like order creation, cancellations, and returns, the integration reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and increases operational efficiency. It also synchronizes shipping and delivery details, helping you provide accurate and timely updates to customers ‚Äî a key to delivering a superior B2C customer experience.

The BigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud package is designed to integrate key end-to-end business processes between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce, enabling smooth, automated data flow and operational consistency across both platforms.

The following core business processes are supported out of the box:

üì¶ From SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce:

  • ‚úÖ Replicate Products ‚Äì Ensure accurate and up-to-date product information is reflected in your BigCommerce storefront.
  • üìä Replicate Product Stock ‚Äì Keep inventory levels in sync to avoid overselling or stockouts.
  • üí≤ Replicate Product Prices & Discounts ‚Äì Automatically update pricing and promotional details in BigCommerce.
  • üöö Replicate Delivery Details ‚Äì Provide timely and accurate shipping information to your customers via BigCommerce.

üõíFrom BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP:

  • üë• Replicate B2C Customers ‚Äì Capture and transfer customer data from BigCommerce to SAP, enabling centralized customer management.
  • üßæReplicate Orders ‚Äì Seamlessly transfer incoming sales orders into SAP for fulfillment and processing.
  • ‚ùå Replicate Order Cancellations ‚Äì Reflect cancelled orders in SAP for proper stock and financial reconciliation.
  • üîÅ Replicate Order Returns ‚Äì Automatically push return details from BigCommerce into SAP to streamline reverse logistics.

Together, these integration flows deliver a robust, automated B2C commerce experience, reducing manual interventions and ensuring your front-end and back-end systems remain in sync.

üöÄ How to Set Up the ‚ÄúBigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition‚Äù Package

Integrating BigCommerce with SAP Cloud ERP is now easier than ever ‚Äî thanks to the pre-built accelerator available on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This step-by-step guide will help you configure and deploy the integration package using SAP Integration Suite, so your systems can work together seamlessly.

‚úÖPrerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

  • üîë  An SAP Partner Account with access to SAP Integration Suite (via SAP BTP ‚Äì Business Technology Platform).
  • üßæ Access to SAP Cloud ERP.
  • üõç  A BigCommerce Partner or Merchant Account.SAP Cloud ERP
  • üìò  Basic knowledge of SAP BTP, Integration Suite and BigCommerce . 
  • üåê  Access to SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • üìòDetailed Configure Guide - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Refer to BigCommerce Receiver Adapter | SAP Help Portal

 üõ†Ô∏è  Step 1: Set Up SAP Integration Suite instance using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) account.

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Create a Subaccount and enable Integration Suite:
    • Navigate to your Global Account > Subaccount.
    • Create or open an Integration Suite instance.
    • Assign relevant entitlements and Assign relevant roles
    • Use the Booster Enable Integration Suite to automate setup or configure manually
    • for more details refer to sap help documentation SAP Integration Suite | SAP Help Portal

üì¶ Step 2: Import the BigCommerce Adapter Package into SAP Integration Suite

  1. Goto SAP Integration Suite instance
  2. Go to Discover tab.
  3. Search for ‚ÄúBigCommerce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite‚Äù.
  • Click ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù to add / move the package to your Design workspace.

  • To Configure BigCommerce Adapter Installation - Installing the BigCommerce Adapter is a prerequisite to use the Integration Content. For adapter installation, refer to the ‚ÄúBigCommerce Adapter Guide‚Äù and also refer to section Configure Adapter in Communication Channels and documents section in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

üîÑStep 3: Configure BigCommerce iFlows (Integration Flows) with API access relevant details.

  1. Go to Design > Integrations in the Integration Suite.
  2. Open the imported BigCommerce Integration Package.
  3. Select a relevant iFlow (e.g., Replicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  4. Configure the necessary Externalized Parameters and Connections, referencing the detailed documentation for each Integration Flow.
  5. To Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP - the mandatory configurations which need to be performed in the SAP Cloud ERP before you can start implementing the configuration for BigCommerce API and configuring the Integration Content in SAP Integration Suite and for more details refer to section "Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  6. Sample configuration shown below.

      BigCommerce Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • BigCommerce Base Url: https://<yourshop>.myBigCommerce.com/
  • BigCommerce Secure Parameter: The name of the BigCommerce access token secure parameter 

       SAP Cloud ERP Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Base Url: https://<your-sap-s4-hana-instance-id>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • Credential Name: The name of the SAP Cloud ERP secure parameter 

üß© Example Integration Flows:

  • BigCommerce ‚ûú SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition : Customer Replication, New Orders, Order Cancellations & Returns
  • SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition ‚ûú BigCommerce : Products, Inventory Synchronization, Stock Availability, Delivery Status

üöÄStep 4: Deploy and Test the Integration Package in Integration Suite

  1. Deploy selected iFlows from your Design workspace.
  2. Monitor from Monitor > Integrations > Message Processing Logs.
  3. Perform test transactions: for more details refer to Demo section in the blog
    • Place a test order in BigCommerce.
    • Monitor the message logs and confirm data replication in SAP Cloud ERP: Sales Orders, Business Partners, Product Catalog

üîß Extend or Customize the Package (Optional)

As a partner you can extend or tailor the integration through:

  • Customer Exits to plug-in your custom integration flows (Pre Exits and Post Exits in Intergration Flows)
  • Copy and modify the integration content.
  • Groovy scripts to customize payload mappings.
  • Content Modifiers to apply business logic.
  • Enhanced error handling and alerting.

 üí° Partner Tips & Monetization Opportunities

As an SAP Partner, you can:

  • üí° Extend the integration flows and Build new integration flows using SAP BigCommerce adapter
  • üìú  Demo your solution with real-time order sync and inventory updates, build a demo to show real-time sync between BigCommerce and SAP with custom business case.
  • üß∞ Buildc Multi-Tenant Integration Templates for reuse across customers.
  • üß† Leverage SAP Integration Advisor for intelligent mapping.
  • üí°  Add your branding, services, or vertical-specific enhancements.

High Level Demo Flow to showcase Order processing along with Master data replication.

  • Step 1 : View the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package in Integration Suite
  • Step 2: Show product in SAP Cloud ERP  (to be replicated to BigCommerce)
  • Step 3: Start replication of product in integration suite
  • Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product
  • Step 5: Log into BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products
  • Step 6: Select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket
  • Step 7: Enter the relevant details like payment and create order
  • Step 8: Check the order created in BigCommerce
  • Step 9: Replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as internal_sales_rep and look for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app and open the sales order and change the order date to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as shipping_specialist and open app ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù
  • Step 12: Enter shipping point and enter the sales order and shipping date as todays date and save , note down the Outbound Delivery ID
  • Step 13: Open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter Outbound Delivery ID and enter Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter picking quantity as 1 and save
  • Step 14 : Click on Post GI and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to Completely Processed. Note : show the SO Process flow of created order in SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 15 : Replicate the Outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce.
  • Step 16: Open sales order in BigCommerce and show the OD created in SAP Cloud ERP reflected in metadata fields of Sales order and status of Sales Order is changed to fulfilled.

Detailed Demo steps:

BigCommerce Demo systems include the following systems - Integration Suite Tenant [along with BTP Sub-Account), SAP Cloud ERP, BigCommerce Admin Portal

Step 1:  Access the  Integration Suite tenant and view ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù integration package

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù -> ‚ÄúIntegration‚Äù
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , view the integration flows and details. 

Step 2: Access to SAP Cloud ERP System to show the replicating product master

  • Access system using URL SAP Cloud ERP system as Product Master Specialist
  • Login with user = prodmaster_specialist
  • Launch the App : ‚ÄúManage Product Master Data‚Äù  and search for Product ID  (sample product ID - TG11)
  • Note: in the demo product replication integration flow we are replicating only one product with product ID (sample product ID - TG11) and user could decide to replicate all products / sub-set of products, based on specific functional requirements.

Step 3: Start replication of product in Integration Suite

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Discover -> Integration (only first time)
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> copy the package
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  ,
  • Navigate to ‚Äúartifacts‚Äù and search for integration package ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
    • To deploy => click on the ‚Äú3 dots‚Äù of integration package and select ‚Äúdeploy‚Äù
    • Deploy would start the product replication from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce

Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product

  • Login using URL : BigCommerce
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúProducts‚Äù
  • Check and prepare the product for selling to customer
    • Check the product is replicated
    • Check the Stock, Price (Default Price) , SKU (Product ID in S4 Public)
    • Check the product Inventory Details (Current Stock)  
    • Add the picture to publish 
    • Make sure to change the visibility status of product from "Disabled" to "Visible"
    • Note: only the product visibility status is "Visible" can be sold .
  • ‚ÄúSave‚Äù the product

Step 5: login to BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products

Step 6: select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket

  • Navigate to "Orders" -> "All Orders" 
  • Click on "Add" 
  • In the first step of order creation, enter the "Customer Info" , enter the "Existing Customer" / "Create New Customer" 
  • Search for the "Existing Customer" and Select the Currency
  • Enter the Billing Information 
  • Add the Product , Search for the existing replicated Product
  • Click on Next
  • Select the Fulfillment, 

Step 7: enter the relevant details like payment details

  • Select the Payment Provider, Card Type, Expiration Date details
  • Enter the Credit Card Holder Name, Credit Card Number, 
  • Click on "Save and Process Payment"  , order would be placed         

Step 8: check the order created in BigCommerce

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù -> "All Orders" 
  • Check the order created with status ‚ÄúAwaiting Fulfillment‚Äù , note down the ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Order ID‚Äù  , order ID would be used to search order created in SAP Cloud ERP system      
  • Note: SAP Cloud ERP Order ID can be found "Metafields" 

Step 9: replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Replication of orders in status Unfulfilled would be moved to SAP Cloud ERP .
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù      

Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP system as Sales Representative

  • open for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app
  • open the sales order and check the order details
  • To create outbound delivery" follow detailed steps in step 11   
     

Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as Delivery shipping specialist and complete the delivery of Sales Order

  • open for ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù app

Step 12: Enter the key details like Shipping Point and Sales Order ...

  • enter shipping point sample as 3310 (select shipping point relevant for your use-case) and enter the sales order ID create earlier and Selection Date (select the relevant delivery date)
  • click on ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù
  • note down the outbound delivery ID

Step 13: Delivery shipping specialist will pic the outbound delivery

  • open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù id and enter ‚ÄúActual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 22/10/2025) , enter ‚Äúpicking quantity‚Äù as 1 and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù         

 

Step 14 : Delivery shipping specialist will Post Goods Issue for the corresponding outbound delivery

  • click on ‚ÄúPost GI‚Äù and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to ‚ÄúCompletely Processed‚Äù.      

 

Note : show the Sales Order ‚ÄúProcess flow‚Äù of created order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition for the corresponding order, the process flow gives visual representation of business entities created in the system (Order, Outbound Delivery, Invoice ‚Ä¶)

 

Step 15 : replicate the Outbound delivery from S4 public to BigCommerce .

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Delivery Details from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Replication of outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP system would be moved to BigCommerce and corresponding Order status would updated to ‚Äúfulfilled‚Äù in BigCommerce
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù         

Step 16: open sales order in BigCommerce and check the  status of Order, it should be changed from ‚ÄúAwaiting Fulfillment‚Äù to ‚ÄúShipped‚Äù

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù
  • With the successfully delivery , the order should be fulfilled and order status should be ‚ÄúShipped‚Äù ,
  • note the fields ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Order ID‚Äù  and ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Outbound Deliveries‚Äù  in order would be copied from SAP Cloud ERP system , the custom fields can be found as part of "Metadata App" (as shown in the below snapshot)      

     

The above steps completes the High Level Demo Flow which showcase the order processing along with product master data replication.

Note: The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package covers Order Returns and Order Cancellation business scenarios along with Order Processing, please feel free to explore the other business process like Order Returns and Order Cancellation .

entry.title: Customers and Partners Innovate Without Limits on SAP BTP with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build
entry.content:
Across industries and around the world, organizations are discovering new possibilities with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). By connecting their business ecosystem, building apps, and automating processes with intelligence, they‚Äôre driving faster innovation and growth.

With SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build, companies can easily connect systems, create applications quickly, and automate processes with AI, unlocking value and agility like never before.

Here are some of the ways customers and partners are driving transformation with SAP BTP.

Olam Agri: Unlocking Cash Flow and Real-Time Insights

  • Global agri-business Olam Agri (S$33.2 billion in annual revenue) transformed its finance operations with SAP BTP.
  • In just nine months, Olam Agri migrated from ECC to RISE with SAP on AWS, covering 35 countries and 90 entities.
  • Using SAP Integration Suite, the company established real-time bank connectivity and freed S$250 million in treasury cash.
  • With SAP Build, Olam Agri created cost-tracking apps that deliver near-real-time visibility across its global operations.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the Olam Agri Story to see how connected finance drives results.

Mindsprint: Scaling Digital Transformation Worldwide

  • Operating in more than 60 countries, Mindsprint helps customers accelerate their RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP journeys.
  • Using SAP Integration Suite, Mindsprint connects SAP and non-SAP systems while maintaining a clean ERP core. With SAP Build, Mindsprint develops scalable custom extensions and AI-driven process intelligence to help customers optimize their business performance.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the Mindsprint Partner Story to learn how innovation scales globally.

Visa: Embedding Payments Seamlessly into ERP

  • Visa Commercial Solutions, in collaboration with ABeam Consulting, is simplifying B2B payments through embedded finance.
  • With SAP Integration Suite, Visa connected its global payment network directly to SAP systems, enabling automated reconciliation and direct invoice payments.
  • Using SAP Build, the team delivered a smooth in-app payment experience from concept to go-live in just six months.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the Visa Story to see how embedded finance accelerates business.

ABeam Consulting: Driving Intelligent Enterprise Innovation

  • With more than 9,000 consultants across Asia, ABeam Consulting delivers end-to-end SAP transformations across SAP ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, Ariba, and Concur.
  • Leveraging SAP BTP with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build, ABeam helps customers integrate complex system landscapes while extending business processes with rapid application development that leverages AI and Joule-powered automation.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the ABeam Partner Story to see how automation and AI are redefining enterprise innovation.

Mamee: Building Agility and Modernizing Operations

  • Snacking leader Mamee partnered with cbs Consulting to strengthen its operations and build a more agile business foundation.
  • Implemented RISE with SAP, SAP Integration Suite, and SAP Build.
  • Reduced integration errors by 70%.
  • Achieved 100% improvement in cash-flow monitoring and 50% faster approvals.
  • With a modern, connected digital core, Mamee is fueling growth with greater efficiency and transparency.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the Mamee Story to see how digital agility drives performance.

cbs Consulting: Partnering for Continuous Innovation

  • With more than 30 years of SAP partnership, cbs Consulting helps organizations move confidently to the cloud and innovate on SAP BTP.
  • cbs Consulting develops smart extensions, automates processes, and connects SAP and non-SAP systems with SAP Build and SAP Integration Suite. Its accelerators help customers reduce technical debt and streamline migrations to SAP S/4HANA.
  • Through close collaboration with SAP, cbs is embedding AI and machine learning into customer solutions.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the cbs Partner Story to learn about their innovative approach.

Now It's Your Turn to Innovate Without Limits

I hope these stories inspire you to start your innovation journey with SAP BTP. Explore how SAP partners can help you with their deep experience, skills, and domain expertise with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build solutions. 

Register now for complimentary partner discovery webinars or workshops to see how they can help you. 

  • SAP Integration Suite Partner Webinars  
  • SAP Build Partner Discovery Workshops

If you‚Äôre an SAP partner, access a wealth of exclusive resources on SAP PartnerEdge to further accelerate your growth and success with SAP BTP.

entry.title: Seamlessly Expand from Event Mesh to Advanced Event Mesh with Our New Export Feature
entry.content:
Have you started your event-driven journey with the Event Mesh capability in SAP Integration Suite? It's the perfect service to begin, offering direct integration with SAP S/4HANA events and a focused feature set that caters to low to moderate event volumes. It‚Äôs ideal for businesses just beginning their EDA journey.

As your EDA implementation matures and expands, you may need to handle higher event volumes, require more sophisticated eventing capabilities, or need broader landscape coverage.

We are excited to announce that you can now easily expand from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh to meet those demands. SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh is a separately priced offering that unlocks a new level of event management with powerful features, including:

  • Event Streaming: Handle massive volumes of events with advanced features like queuing, streaming, and replay.
  • Partitioned Queues: Ensure ordered processing by publishing messages with similar contexts to the same consumer.
  • Dynamic Message Routing: Automatically determine how to forward event messages within and across clusters.
  • Distributed Tracing: Trace the complete lifecycle of an event as it travels through the event mesh.
  • Flexible Deployments: Extend beyond public and private cloud environments to hybrid and on-premises broker deployments.
  • Event Management: Create, design, share, and manage various aspects of your EDA.
  • Event Monitoring and Insights: Curated dashboards, clear visualizations from historical and real-time metrics, with timely event broker notifications.

Learn more about SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh's key features and pricing here: What is Advanced Event Mesh?

Introducing "Export Configuration"

To make your transition journey smoother, we've introduced a powerful new feature directly in the Event Mesh UI: the "Export Configuration" button.

Screenshot of the Event Mesh in Integration Suite UI, featuring a new "Export Configuration" button in the top right corner

 

This new function is the first step to move to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by downloading the configuration artifacts from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite. With a single click, you can export your existing metadata ‚Äî including queues, topic subscriptions, and settings ‚Äî into a Terraform infrastructure-as-code (.tf) file.

To guide you through the expand process from Event Mesh to Advanced Event Mesh, we published a new migration guide. You can access it here: Migration from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh

How Does the Migration Work?

The new export feature is the starting point for a streamlined, five-step migration process:

  1. Export: Navigate to the Event Mesh capability in the SAP Integration Suite UI and click the new "Export Configuration" button to download your .tf file.
  2. Edit: Open the downloaded file and add the credentials for your new, empty SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh broker instance.
  3. Import: Use standard Terraform commands (init, plan, apply) to automatically provision your queues and topic subscriptions in SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.
  4. Adapt Applications: Adjust your sender and consumer applications to connect to the new SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh endpoints. This may involve updating connection details, libraries, and topic wildcard syntax.
  5. Migrate Applications: Choose a migration strategy that fits your needs ‚Äî either a phased, application-by-application rollout or a "big bang" switchover during a maintenance window.

This new process significantly reduces the manual effort and complexity previously associated with such a migration, allowing you to focus on leveraging the advanced capabilities of your new environment.

Ready to Get Started?

Unlock the full potential of your event-driven architecture and expand to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh today.

For a complete, step-by-step guide on the entire process, please refer to our official documentation on the SAP Help Portal:

Migration from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh

entry.title: Debugging ‚Äúunsupported_grant_type‚Äù in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration ‚Äî A Complete Walkthrough
entry.content:
Author: Ayush Aggarwal
*SAP Integration Developer | Building Reliable SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration Interfaces | Passionate about Real-World Problem Solving

üß† Introduction

If you‚Äôve ever integrated SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration with an on-prem OAuth token service, you‚Äôve probably seen this frustrating response at least once:

{"error": "unsupported_grant_type"}

It looks like a backend issue ‚Äî but in my case, the real problem was layered across Cloud Integration, Groovy, and the Cloud Connector.

Everything worked perfectly in Postman, yet consistently failed inside SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration.
Here‚Äôs how I diagnosed and resolved it ‚Äî step by step.

‚öôÔ∏èThe Scenario

My SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration iFlow needed to fetch an OAuth token from an on-premise endpoint (hosted on Microsoft IIS / ASP.NET) through the SAP Cloud Connector.

The expected request looked like this:

POST /token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=password&
username=API_USER&
password=MySecurePassword123!&
oauth_bearer_secret=AbCdEfGhIjKlMnOpQrStUvWxYz123456$CF)J@NcRf&
ip=192.168.0.10

In Postman, this returned a valid token instantly.
But from SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration, the response was always:

{"error": "unsupported_grant_type"}

üîçStep 1 ‚Äì Verifying Headers and Cloud Connector Path

The first thing I checked was the HTTP Request Headers in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration trace (Before HTTP Adapter).
To my surprise, it only showed Cloud Connector‚Äìrelated headers:

SAP-Connectivity-ConsumerAccount
SAP-Connectivity-SCC-Location_ID
SAP-PASSPORT

No Content-Type, no Accept.
That meant the backend wasn‚Äôt even treating my payload as a form submission ‚Äî it was likely ignoring the body completely.

üß† Step 2 ‚Äì Encoding and Header Configuration

Next, I added a Groovy Script before the HTTP adapter to URL-encode all fields safely:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import java.net.URLEncoder

def Message processData(Message message) {
    def props = message.getProperties()
    def enc = { v -> URLEncoder.encode(v ?: "", "UTF-8") }

    def body = "grant_type=${enc(props.get('Grant_type'))}" +
               "&username=${enc(props.get('User'))}" +
               "&password=${enc(props.get('Password'))}" +
               "&oauth_bearer_secret=${enc(props.get('Secret'))}" +
               "&ip=${enc(props.get('IP'))}"

    message.setHeader("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
    message.setHeader("Accept", "application/json")
    message.setBody(body)
    return message
}

Still no luck ‚Äî the same error persisted.

üïµÔ∏è Step 3 ‚Äì The ‚ÄúAha!‚Äù Moment: HTTP Method Was GET

After a few more trace analyses, I finally spotted the culprit:
My HTTP adapter was configured to use GET, because we were ‚Äújust fetching a token.‚Äù

But OAuth token endpoints must always use POST.

Why?
Because they only parse grant_type, username, and password from the body, not from the query string.

Changing the method to POST immediately changed the server‚Äôs behavior ‚Äî the request started reaching the backend handler correctly.

‚ö†Ô∏èStep 4 ‚Äì Another Twist: Groovy GString Conversion Error

Just when I thought it was fixed, SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration threw a new error:

org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException:
No type converter available to convert from type GStringImpl to InputStream

This happens because Groovy‚Äôs string interpolation ("${variable}") produces a GString, not a plain String ‚Äî
and the HTTP adapter can‚Äôt automatically convert it into an InputStream.

The fix?
Convert the body to a plain String explicitly before setting it:

message.setBody(body.toString())

That single .toString() solved the conversion issue once and for all.

üéâStep 5 ‚Äì Success!

After redeploying with:

  • HTTP Method: POST

  • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

  • Body: body.toString()

‚Ä¶the flow finally returned a 200 OK and a valid token JSON üéØ

üßæ Summary of Root Causes

Layer Issue Fix

SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration ConfigurationMethod was set to GETChange to POST
Groovy ScriptBody was a GStringImplUse .toString()
Cloud ConnectorContent-Type wasn‚Äôt passed earlierRe-add header right before HTTP adapter

üß† Key Learnings for SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration Developers

‚úÖAlways use POST when requesting OAuth tokens ‚Äî GET requests won‚Äôt parse the body.
‚úÖConvert Groovy interpolated strings to Java strings using .toString().
‚úÖSet Content-Type explicitly as application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
‚úÖRead the trace logs carefully ‚Äî the ‚ÄúBefore HTTP Adapter‚Äù payload is your truth source.
‚úÖDon‚Äôt assume that Postman and SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration behave the same ‚Äî even identical payloads can differ in transport semantics.

üì∑Screenshots

  • SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration HTTP Receiver Adapter configuration

  • 404 Error

  • Successful token response in trace

üí¨Conclusion

This issue was a reminder that in integration, 99% of ‚Äúbackend errors‚Äù come from how we send the data, not the data itself.

After hours of debugging, the fix turned out to be:

  • One configuration change (POST instead of GET)

  • One line of code (body.toString())

Sometimes, the smallest details make the biggest difference.

 

üë§About the Author

Ayush Aggarwal is an SAP Integration Developer with expertise in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration, Cloud Connector, and data integrations across SAP and cloud platforms.
He enjoys sharing practical, real-world lessons learned from deep debugging scenarios to help fellow developers save time and effort.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Sunny Kapoor and I am a lead product manager for the cloud integration capability of SAP Integration Suite, specializing in enterprise-wide business process integration and digital transformation. With 15 years of professional experience, I offer a comprehensive understanding of both technical implementation and strategic product oversight.

My Session: 

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture | Tuesday, Nov 4 | 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET

What you will learn about: 

This session introduces attendees to the power of event-driven integration pattern to deliver real-time grounding data, equipping AI system's with the latest business context to make informed and accurate decisions.

AI Grounding is the process of connecting an AI system's abstract knowledge and responses to specific, real-world data and context, reducing "hallucinations" and increasing the reliability and accuracy of its outputs.

 
This session focuses into the advanced realm of real-time vector grounding, where you'll connect structured enterprise data to a large language model using SAP HANA Cloud‚Äôs vector database, SAP Integration Suite, and Advanced Event Mesh. Experience firsthand how dynamic data updates can enhance the model's responses in real time, maintaining their contextual precision. By session's end, you'll have constructed an end-to-end, event-driven flow that responds to new sales order events from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and support case events from SAP Service Cloud Version 2, providing an AI assistant with live contextual intelligence. This hands-on scenario simulates an AI-powered Customer Success Digital Assistant, equipping it with real-time sales and support data to deliver accurate insights and informed decision-making capabilities.

Co-speakers:

Prashant Gautam, Senior Product Manager, has been with SAP since 2004. With strong focus on innovation, he works on advancing Artificial Intelligence capabilities in SAP Integration Suite, driving efficiency and modernisation in integration space.

 

Karsten Strothmann is lead product manager and evangelist for event-driven integration at SAP SE in Walldorf, Germany. With over 25 years of experience in the software industry, he has extensively focused on Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) and its implementation at the enterprise level.

 

Piyush Gakhar heads the cross product management & strategy for Integration solutions such as SAP Integration Suite, API Management, Event Mesh & SAP Process Orchestration.

 

 

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions üëá 

https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/shape-what-s-next-with-sap-integration-suite-at-teched-2025/ba-p/14220264 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

You can also gain some further knowledge around SAP Integration Suite and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by attending the following SAP TechEd sessions:

  • IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture
    • Deep Dive
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET
  • IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Thursday, Nov 6 | 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET
  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET
  • IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET

Related community topic pages: 

  •  SAP Integration Suite
  • Joule 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

Join to learn how event-driven integration patterns can keep AI systems contextually aware and up-to-date with the latest business information.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts on the concept of real-time data grounding using evet-driven architecture. Share your insights and ideas by answering these questions in the comments below:

  • In what ways do you think real-time vector grounding can enhance the capabilities of AI Agents.
  • How do you plan to apply the skills and knowledge gained from this workshop to your ongoing or future projects?

Let's start a conversation and learn from each other's perspectives! 

Don't forget to register for the workshop to secure your spot and join us for this hands-on learning experience!

entry.title: SAP Cloud Integration ‚Äì A Deep Dive into the IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Adapter
entry.content:
As businesses increasingly operate across both cloud and on-premise systems, they need a reliable way for these environments to communicate seamlessly in real time. The SAP Integration Suite enables this by providing a rich set of adapters that ensure secure, scalable, and effortless connectivity between systems. In this blog, I will discuss one of the recently released IBM MQ Adapter.

IBM MQ Adapter in SAP CI

IBM MQ is a secure and reliable messaging solution that enables applications, systems, services, and files to communicate by exchanging messages through queues. It simplifies and accelerates the integration of applications and the sharing of business data across diverse platforms.

The IBM MQ Adapter is available in both sender and receiver modes to streamline message-based workflows and comes in two variants ‚Äî REST and JMS (Java Message Service).

Key Features

The IBM MQ Adapter (JMS variant) provides the following key features:

  • Sender adapter facilitates automatic message delivery via JMS Subscribe variant and Supports Persistent and Non-persistent message delivery via JMS.
  • Supports Transactional JMS Session for data consistency and Byte and Text JMS messages.
  • Provides multiple actions for failed transaction handling: Keep the Message and Process Again or Move to Another Queue.
  • Receiver adapter allows reliable publishing of messages to Topics and Queues.
  • Supports multiple authentications: Basic, Client Certificate, and None.

Practical Use Case Walkthrough:

Here we will demonstrate how to write employee data (sending it as a message) to a queue on the IBM MQ server using IBM MQ Receiver adapter and read the message from the queue with help of the IBM MQ Sender Adapter.

IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter: Write Employee Data to a Queue

Architecture for IBM MQ Receiver adapter

When the IBM MQ Adapter is used as a receiver adapter, SAP Integration Suite acts as the initiator of the calls.

SAP Integration Suite tenant sends the operation request to IBM MQ (this is a receiver system), IBM MQ Receiver Adapter works on the request and sends the data back using JMS protocol to the SAP Integration Suite tenant.

Prepare Details

In the Content Modifier, you can define employee details, such as names, organization, role, and salary.

EmployeeId: EMP1005
EmployeeName: Shubham
Organization: XX Industries
Role: Senior Analyst
Salary: 75000
Join Date: 2025-10-07

Configure the Connection tab for IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter

The Connection tab includes connection and authentication settings for IBM MQ Adapter.

For more information regarding the authentication, refer to the IBM MQ for SAP Integration Suite.

Connection Tab:

Parameter

Description

Hostname

Specify the hostname to connect to IBM MQ.

Port

Specify the port number to connect to IBM MQ.

Example as 31656

Authentication

Select the type of authentication for connecting to IBM MQ:

  • Basic: Provides authentication using User Credentials.
  • Client Certificate: The server authenticates the client by receiving the client's certificate during the SSL handshake and verifying that the certificate is valid.
  • None: Direct connection can be made without User Credentials.

Credential Name

Specify the User Credential artifact that stores the username-password pair.

Example as IBM_MQ_54

Proxy type

Select the proxy type as Internet

SSL Cipher Suite

The specific set of cryptographic algorithms used to establish a secure, encrypted connection (SSL/TLS) between the adapter and the IBM MQ queue manager.

Example as *TLS12HIGHER

Queue Manager Name

Specify the name of the queue manager to connect for messaging.

Example as MQD

Channel Name

Specify the Channel Name in IBM MQ.

Example as CLOUD.APP.SVRCONN

Application Name

Specify the Application Name for the connection.

Example as MainApplication

Transport/Network Protocol

Select the type of protocol as TCP/IP.

Character Set ID (CCSID) for Non-ASCII Names

Specify the Character Set ID (CCSID) for Non-ASCII Names for the JMS connection.

Example: 819

Execute Write Message Using the IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter

Go to the Processing tab, select the Message Destination Type as Queue, and specify the Queue Name where the message will be sent on the IBM MQ server.

Select the Target Client as JMS-Compliant and enable the Transactional JMS Session to ensure data consistency.

Processing Tab:

Parameter

Description

Message Destination Type

Select the Message Destination Type as Queue

Queue Name

(only available when Message Destination Type is set to Queue)

Specify the name of the queue to write.

Example as DemoQueue1

Target Client

Select the target client type as JMS-Compliant: JMS message properties and headers will be accessible.

Transactional JMS Session

Enable the checkbox to ensure data consistency.

Advanced Message Properties

Parameter

Description

Message Type

Select the Message Type as Text.

Correlation ID

Specify the correlation ID, which is a 48-character hexadecimal encoded string, representing 24 bytes as 414d5120514d4144455620202020202067d8bf5923582e02

Note

You can also specify an application-specific value, like My Custom CorelID. This sets the correlation ID of the created message.

Delivery Mode

Select the message delivery mode as Persistent.

ReplyTo Destination

Specify the destination as QMGR2.

Expiry

Specify the message expiration time as 60000 milliseconds

Priority

Specify the priority for the message. The value can range from 0-9.

Time Stamp

Specify the message timestamp as 60000 in milliseconds.

Once the adapter is deployed successfully, we can verify it in the monitoring tab. In response, we will receive the message details in the header.

In the IBM MQ Application, here we can see that employee details have been written in the mentioned Queue (DemoQueue1).

Reading Employee Data from a Queue Using the IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Sender Adapter

Once the data is written on the queue, now we will see how we can use the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter to read a message from the same queue.

Sender Adapter (JMS Subscribe)

The IBM MQ Sender adapter is designed to function as a sender adapter. In such a scenario where the adapter is used as a sender adapter, IBM MQ (Subscribe) acts as the initiator of the calls.

The adapter subscribes to a specific queue/topic, receiving messages as they are published. A subscription enables automatic receipt of messages when you subscribe to a specific message destination type.

Configure the Connection tab for IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Sender Adapter

**All the Connection tab details for IBM MQ Sender are the same as JMS Receiver explained above**

Read a Message using the IBM MQ JMS (Subscribe) Sender Adapter

In the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter, you can read a message by selecting the Message Destination Type as Queue and specifying the Queue Name from where the message will be read on the IBM MQ server.

You can also enable Transactional JMS Session for data consistency and select Failed Transactions Handling according to your scenario. Specify the Max Delivery Count and Queue Name if failed transaction handling is selected as Move Message To Another Queue.

Once the adapter is deployed successfully, we can verify it in the monitoring tab. In response, we will receive the message body.

The IBM MQ JMS adapter is a helpful tool in the SAP Integration Suite. It makes it easier to connect IBM MQ systems running in your own data centre with cloud-based systems.

It enables reliable, event-driven messaging and supports robust integration scenarios across hybrid landscapes across both cloud and on-premise setups. As companies grow and update their IT systems, this adapter helps keep everything connected and secure.

Quick Links

For information about IBM MQ adapter configuration, see SAP Help | IBM MQ Adapter. 

For detailed information about the IBM MQ adapter, see IBM MQ Adapter Guide.

Note: The IBM MQ adapter is available as part of your SAP Integration Suite license.

Labels

  • Technology Updates‚Äã
  • IBMMQ JMS

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Here‚Äôs my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Berlin (November 4-6, 2025) offers the flagship in-person experience where you'll connect directly with SAP experts, participate in hands-on workshops, and build lasting professional relationships within the global SAP community
  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.

entry.title: Everything you need to get started with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh
entry.content:
Introduction - Why Now Is the Moment to get started with Event-driven Architecture

As enterprises accelerate their journey to the cloud, business requirements are evolving at a rapid pace. SAP S/4HANA is increasingly being positioned as the digital core - designed to support greater agility, continuous transformation, and real-time responsiveness. In globally distributed organizations, the demand for instant data access and the need to decouple core systems from fast-moving innovations are defining a new dimension of how businesses operate.

Despite this shift, several integration challenges stand in the way of a seamless cloud transformation:

  • Traditional on-premise integration technologies are no longer sufficient to meet the speed, flexibility, and scalability required by today‚Äôs hybrid, cloud-based landscapes.
  • Modern integration approaches must be cloud-native and hybrid by design, capable of operating reliably across regionally distributed environments and ecosystems.
  • Real-time, event-based integration is becoming the emerging best practice, especially for high-volume, data-driven scenarios such as omnichannel commerce and intelligent supply chains.

SAP‚Äôs Answer?

SAP has developed a comprehensive response to these evolving needs by extending the SAP Integration Suite with modern, event-driven capabilities:

  • SAP Integration Suite provides powerful, cloud-ready tools and methodologies to enable integration across heterogeneous IT landscapes - on-premise, cloud, or hybrid.
  • Legacy on-premise integration architectures can be efficiently transformed into scalable, cloud-based models to meet today‚Äôs agility and performance requirements.
  • Event-driven integrations complement traditional methods by enabling real-time, loosely coupled interactions between systems - powering new business models and dynamic processes.

To support this, SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh offers a fully managed, enterprise-grade event streaming and management service which includes a robust set of features built for enterprise needs:

  • A distributed mesh of event brokers that can be deployed across any environment - public or private cloud, on-premise, or hybrid setups.
  • Elastic scalability, from small-scale projects to very large enterprise-grade use cases, without compromising performance or reliability.
  • Comprehensive support for event streaming, event management, and event monitoring, ensuring full visibility and control.
  • An advanced management toolset with features like message routing, filtering, deployment configuration, and distributed tracing to ensure seamless operations.

 

Complementing Traditional Integration Approaches

While event-driven architecture opens up new possibilities, it‚Äôs not a replacement - it‚Äôs a powerful complement. SAP Integration Suite continues to serve as a leading integration platform-as-a-service (iPaaS), enabling smooth integration of cloud and on-premise applications. Advanced Event Mesh enhances this by delivering a global, enterprise-grade event mesh, complete with the tools needed to operate and optimize it for maximum business value.

 

What is the value of Event-driven Architectures?

Today‚Äôs enterprise IT landscapes are often burdened by legacy integration patterns that are no longer fit for purpose. These outdated methods not only limit agility but also introduce complexity, latency, and inefficiencies across systems. Several common patterns highlight the limitations of traditional integration:

  • Batch Delivery introduces delays in transmitting information across systems.
  • Point-to-Point Connections result in a tangled web of integrations that are brittle and hard to scale.
  • Periodic Polling causes unnecessary system load and latency, constantly checking for updates.
  • Decentralized Data leaves critical information scattered and siloed across various domains.

With digital transformation accelerating and real-time responsiveness becoming essential, this traditional approach simply can‚Äôt keep up. Modern businesses need an integration model that is more flexible, scalable, and event-aware. This is where event-driven architecture comes into play. Rather than building rigid connections between applications, this model embraces asynchronous communication, where events trigger actions across a loosely coupled ecosystem. The advantages of this approach are clear:

  • Broadcasting: Events are published across a mesh; applications can subscribe to what‚Äôs relevant to them.
  • Decoupling: The publisher doesn't need to know who consumes the events, simplifying development and enabling flexible scaling.
  • Filtering: Subscribers only receive the information they‚Äôve explicitly asked for - nothing more, nothing less.

By shifting to an event-driven mindset, enterprises can significantly reduce integration complexity, respond to changes in real time, and create more resilient, adaptive system architectures.

Many organizations are held back by spaghetti architectures - a tangle of point-to-point integrations that are hard to manage and slow to adapt. These rigid systems make it difficult to innovate, scale, or respond quickly to change.

 

To break free, modern enterprises are adopting a publish-subscribe model powered by events and APIs. Instead of tightly coupled connections, applications communicate through a shared event mesh and standardized APIs - creating a modular, flexible integration layer.

This shift enables:

  • Faster rollout of new services
  • Real-time data flow across systems
  • Easier reuse and scaling of integration assets

By moving to an event- and API-driven architecture, you lay the foundation for scalable, agile digital transformation.

 

Resources for the Architect persona: The System Strategist

Event-driven architecture enables real-time visibility into business operations by mirroring key business moments as events (e.g., OrderPlaced, CustomerSignedUp). This empowers decision-makers to:

    • Respond faster to market and customer changes
    • Unlock real-time analytics and insights
    • Drive automation and efficiency across business processes
    • Build a digital foundation for future innovation (AI, ML, IoT)

 

Introductory Assets

Why do I need this asset?

Event-driven Architecture website on SAP.com

Whitepaper on a business-wide Event-driven Architecture

Whitepaper on a future-proof integration Strategy

Before diving deep into the technical details and implementation, take some time to familiarize yourself with event-driven architectures and how SAP can help you achieve them.

Discovery Center Service Entry

Find detailed information about our service, SAP Integration Suite, advanced Event Mesh, in the SAP Discovery Center. You can also access pricing-related details there.

Roadmap

Why do I need this asset?

Roadmap for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh

SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, has a dedicated entry in the SAP Roadmap Explorer. There, you can explore the latest product enhancements and upcoming capabilities to expect in the future.

 

 

Resources for the Architect Persona: The System Strategist

EDA is the architectural pattern that solves critical challenges like tight coupling, brittle integrations, and slow change propagation. Architects adopt EDA to:

    • Decouple systems using asynchronous event flows
    • Build reactive, resilient, and scalable services
    • Align software design with real-world domain events
    • Support microservices and domain-driven design (DDD) practices

 

Learning Journey

Why do I need this asset?

The Devtoberfest sessions are provided by the SAP Developer Advocates team and offer a comprehensive yet technical introduction to many SAP-related technologies. Here, you can find sessions related to event-driven architecture and the advanced event mesh service.

Blogpost on SAP Community

Everyone - whether a customer, partner, or SAP employee - can upload useful content to the SAP Community, including helpful blog posts on event-driven architecture. Here is a collection of blog posts that are particularly useful for this topic.

 

 

Resources for the Technical Persona: The Integration Enabler

Event-driven integration reduces point-to-point complexity and makes systems more manageable. For technical teams, this means:

    • Reduced coupling between applications and platforms
    • Easier SAP and non-SAP system interoperability
    • Improved traceability with centralized event logs
    • More resilient communication patterns (no more failed sync calls!)

 

Discovery Center Mission

Why do I need this asset?

In the SAP Discovery Center, you‚Äôll not only find a service entry for Advanced Event Mesh, but also useful missions that show you how to implement event-driven architecture using SAP technologies.

 Tutorial Navigator

Why do I need this assets

Get started with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh

You can find a great collection of guided, step-by-step hands-on tutorials in the Tutorial Navigator. Here, we recommend the most prominent hands-on enablement for event-driven architecture.

Technical Documentation

Why do I need this assets?

Understanding Event-driven architecture

 

Once you start implementing this technology for your own purposes, you may encounter technical challenges. The most comprehensive source for guidance and technical instructions is the SAP Help Portal. There are two relevant entries: one on Event-driven Architecture in general, and another specifically focused on the SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh service.

 

Thank you very much for tuning into the blogpost. We hope that those assets will help you to accelerate your journey to an Event-driven Architecture with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.
